content: granny time scarf crochet pattern by havuna magic © havuna magic 2025 this pattern is for personal use only materials 2 colors of aran weight yarn and a 5mm crochet hook i used garnstudio drops nepal 50g = 75m / 1 8oz = 82yds color a = brown color b = light yellow stitch marker yarn needle scissors gauge yardage & measurements gauge is not important for this project if you are using the same weight yarn your measurements should be about the same measurements without tassels ~ 230cm/90 5 height x 13cm/5 1 width i used three 50g skeins of color a and two 50g skeins of color b abbreviations us terminology chain=chain single_crochet= single_crochet double_crochet= double_crochet cluster= 3 double_crochet in the same stitch slip_stitch= slip_stitch © havuna magic 2025 this pattern is for personal use only pattern this scarf consists of two long granny rectangles make 2 identical rectangles chain 312 with color a if you want to make the scarf shorter/longer make sure your stitch count is divisible by 3 foundation row single_crochet in the 4th stitch mark the ch3-space with a stitch marker you will make a cluster later in this space single_crochet across round 1 turn chain 3 make 2 double_crochet in the first single_crochet this is your first cluster chain 1 *skip 2 cluster in the next stitch chain 1 * repeat between ** until you have 2 single_crochet and ch3- space left skip 2 in the ch3-space make cluster chain 3 cluster chain 3 cluster chain 1 you are now on the other side of the round *skip 2 cluster in the next stitch chain 1 * clusters should face each other repeat between ** until you have 3 stitches left in the last stitch cluster chain 3 cluster chain 3 join with a slip_stitch in the 3rd chain of the first cluster cut yarn and fasten_off © havuna magic 2025 this pattern is for personal use only round 2 join color b in any ch1-space chain 3 make 2 double_crochet in the same ch1-space this is your first cluster work around repeating *ch1 cluster in the next ch1-space* in the corner ch3-spaces make cluster ch3 cluster join with a slip_stitch in the 3rd chain of the first cluster cut yarn and fasten_off make 2 identical granny rectangles © havuna magic 2025 this pattern is for personal use only joining you can use any joining method you prefer like whip stitch slip_stitch join single crochet join etc to join rectangles together using an invisible seam take a long strand of color b yarn to work with about half longer than your rectangles you can also use a few shorter yarn strands and work in parts face granny rectangles wrong sides together and find the 2nd chain of the corner ch3s from both rectangles with yarn needle start in the 2nd chain of the corner ch3 working only in the back loops pull almost all the yarn through joining the pieces together leave only
